intro: Cyrtandra quadrata, commonly known as the four-angled cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with succulent stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests or rocky areas. Cyrtandra quadrata is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and birds.
